title: Is it better to watch a film rather than read the original book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Both. That way you can compare the film to the book. I generally find the novel to be better by far than the film, for example, “Bonfire of the Vanities,” as a film was a let-down, while the book was superb. The recently released “The Goldfinch” may have fared better as a miniseries, because there was so much material there to shove into a movie— even at 2 1/2 hours. Then again, David Lean managed quite well with Dr. Zhivago, a movie I will see time and again, while reading the novel once was sufficient enough for me. “Lolita” as a movie, even by Stanley Kubrick missed the richness of Nabokov’s phrasing, including the opening sentences of the novel, which to me are among the most memorable and superbly written. The classics generally are entertaining enough as movies, such as “Pride and Prejudice,” and I enjoy comparing its many movie versions, as well as those of “Jane Eyre” and “Wuthering Heights.” Sometimes seeing the film version has prodded me to read the books, as was the case of the original BBC / Masterpiece series runs of “Poldark,” and “I, Claudius” (which is way overdue for a remake). I also read “Big Little Lies” while watching its first season. There was one case for me where the movie proved to be better than the book, and that was “Devil wears Prada.” The book was based on the author’s personal experience, which was entertaining enough, but the screen adaptation (and Meryl Streep) made the movie version lively and memorable.

Totally depends. I know, people will say reading books over movies is the better thing to do. Well, when i first watch harry potter and the sorcerer’s stone i didn’t even know that it’s a book adaption by J.K. Rowling. After so many years, i read sorcerer’s stone and i was dumbstruck by the fact how a movie adapted from a book has missed so much but it’s only legit as we can’t really expect to portray each and every detail. Moving on, i have watched every part of harry potter series and i don’t remember how many times. I have a hp pillow cover, elder wand keychain, harry potter t’s. I even now remember the movie dialogues, each and every character’s name and the spells and what not? But i haven’t read any book apart from the philosopher’s stone. Why? because i have already made such wizardry world in my mind and heart which i didn’t want to change even a little bit. Now let’s walk into the parallel universe. I have read this book last year The kite runner by the author khaled hosseini. I fell in love with the author’s viewpoint. He presented the middle east in pages. I don’t read very often because novels don’t have any images in particular. lol. Judge me, I don’t care but i read this one and his another famous novel i.e. A thousand splendid suns. Reason being his writing has enough potential that you don’t need any pictures to keep the flow intact. The detailing in any tale is everything. Moving on, recently i have come to know there they made the movie The kite runner. I have watched the trailer even but i wasn’t sure to watch, as hassan’s image in my mind is different than how he was looking in the movie adaption. Both time it was the same reason for me that i have already liked something for some specific detailing and i didn’t want to ruin that. So, if you’re okay with such things then you should read the book first as books are far well detailed and has more interesting turns and event than movies.
